div.sent: We know that the Church is a community of Christian believers.
Jesus first founded his Church with the Apostles.
That Community of the Apostles is also known as the apostolic brotherhood.
Therefore, they used to address one another as brethren or dear brothers.
The word `apostle means one who is sent.
The Apostles, as the Church, received their mission and inheritance, from Jesus.
Today there are over 45 crore Christians in the world.
The Christian believers are the Church or the Christian Brotherhood.
Each and every Christian is a member of that Church or Brotherhood.
The Church as Mother was Strengthened by the Gifts of the Holy Spirit.
There were in that room 120 disciples including the eleven Apostles.
Jesus Mother Mary and his relatives were also present there.
All the disciples of Jesus received the Holy Spirit and his power.
All their fear was gone.
At this time many people from various places had come to Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Pentecost.
The disciples of Jesus began to give witness to him by preaching the word to them.
Everyone present heard in his own language what Peter preached.
So, many people other than the Jews came to believe.
This work is still going on and will continue till the end of times.
In the previous lesson we also learned that Jesus had given authority to his disciples and sent them out to preach the Word.
He had warned the disciples saying, Go throughout the whole world and preach the gospel to all mankind.
I am sending you like lambs among wolves.
You must be as cautious as snakes and as gentle as doves.
Go and preach, The Kingdom of God i.s. at hand.
Heal the sick, bring the dead back to life, heal those who suffer from dreaded diseases, and drive out demons.
You have received without paying, so give without being paid.
Don't take a purse or a beggar's bag or shoes; don't stop to greet anyone on the road.
Whenever you go into a house, first say, `Peace be with this house.
Stay in the house that welcomes you, eating and drinking whatever they offer you.
Heal the sick, comfort the sorrowful, and give to each needy person according to your ability.
For my sake you will be brought to trial before rulers and kings, to tell the Good News to them and to the Gentiles.
For the words you will speak, will not be yours.
They will come from the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
Therefore, do not fear.
Every faithful of the Church had to and will have to suffer persecution, in one form or other, for the sake of the gospel.
In the next lesson we will see how Saint Stephen and Saint Peter had to suffer persecution and die.
For the victory of the Church, suffering is unavoidable.
Jesus himself has warned us about it.
The Church and the Holy Bible : The principal religious book of the Church is the Holy Bible.
It contains all the teachings of Jesus.
For the Christians it is a Book of Laws or Life for complete spiritual, moral and human perfection.
The preaching of the word of God does not mean simply to hand over a Bible to someone.
Jesus wanted his -works and message to be preached and understood.
He said, Go and teach all people to obey everything I commanded you.
Preach the gospel to all mankind.
Those who listen to YOU listen to me.
Jesus did not say, Go and give Bible to everyone.
The Apostles did not distribute a single copy of the Bible, for it did not exist in the written form.
They went everywhere and preached the Word of Christ.
They served the people and worked many miracles.
The Apostles worked in the power of the Holy Spirit.
Every baptized Christian is a disciple chosen by Christ.
It is our duty as members of the Church to preach the Word and do good for the people according to our abilities.
God always calls us to devote ourselves to the work of preaching the gospel and to do works of charity.
Can you hear him calling you ?
Are you ready to answer his call ?
But we have to prove our goodwill no merely by words of mouth, but by our action.
To serve our family, society, country and people sincerely and honestly is also a kind of apostolic work.
Jesus himself said, Give to God what belongs to God, and give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar.
Do I consider myself a member of the Church In what ways can I help the Church now ?
What air, I thinking of doing for the Church and for the country when I grow up?
What is my vocation ?
Have I decided how I plan to serve my people and my country?
How do I plan to preach Christ's message of truth and justice?
How will it be possible ?
I will always follow the path of truth and justice, and I will oppose injustice.
I will contribute for the works of the Church to the best of my ability, and I will cooperate with the Church in her work.
I will dedicate myself for the service of people according to my capacity and ability.
I will acquire and practice the virtues of humility, politeness, faithfulness and love of God.
I will-grow up joyful service of God and men.
I will trust in God and assistance of the Holy Spirit as the source of my strength and wisdom.
I have no silver and gold, but I give you what I have; in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.
And all those present understood what the Apostles said in their own language.
Then many were baptized and became Christ's disciples.
Peter was the eldest among the Apostles and John was the youngest.
Jesus Christ appointed Peter as the Head of the Church.
The word Pete means rock.
On this hard and solid rock Christ built his Church.
It is so solid and strong that it will never break down.
At the initial stage of the Church, the Apostles worked many miracles in the name of the Lord Jesus and by his power.
Many who witnessed these miracles put their faith in Christ.
But the Elders and the leaders of society were disturbed by the testimony of the Apostles and the miracles worked by them.
Therefore, they began to accuse them.
So the apostles had to face persecution and imprison ment.
In this lesson we will learn something about that.
In the same way, there were many beggars around the Temple in Jerusalem.
One day Peter and John were going to the Temple at a certain hour to pray.
There at the Beautiful Gate, as it was called, was a man who had been tame all his life.
Every day he was carried to the gate to beg for money from the people who were going into the Temple.
He was crippled from birth.
When he saw Peter and John going in, he begged them to give him something.
Peter and John were moved with pity for the man.
Then he took him by his right hand and helped him up.
At once the man's feet and ankles became strong; he jumped up, stood on his feet, and started walking around.
Then he went into the Temple with them, walking and jumping and praising God.
Seeing the miracles, many people gathered around Peter and John in Solomon's Porch.
Peter then said to the people, Fellow- Israelites, why are you surprised at this, and why do you stare at us?
Do you think that was by means of our own power of godliness that we make this man walk ?
The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our ancestors, has given divine glory to his Servant Jesus.
It was the power of his name that gave strength to this lame man.
But you handed him over to the enemies.
You rejected him in Pilate's presence, even after Pilate had decided to set him free.
Instead you asked Pilate to do you the favour of turning loose a murderer.
You killed the one who leads to life.
But God raised him from death.
It was the power of his name hat gave strength to this lame man.
My brothers, I know that what you and your leaders did to Jesus was due to your ignorance.
God announced long ago through all the prophets that his Messiah had to suffer; and he made it come true in this way.
Repent, then, and turn to God, so that he will forgive your sins.
If you do, times of spiritual strength will come from the Lord.
God announced this through his holy prophets who lived long ago.
For Moses said.
The Lord your God will send you a prophet, just as he sent me, and he will be on of your people.
You are to obey everything that he tells you to do.
Anyone who does not obey that prophet shall be separated from God's people and destroyed.
And all the prophets who had a message, including Samuel and those who came after him, also announced what has been happening these days.
The promises of God through his prophets are for you, and you share in the convenient which God made with your ancestors.
As he said to Abraham, `Through your descendants I will bless all the people on earth.
In those days the Sadducees were members of the noble priestly class.
They forbade them to talk about it.
But the apostles did not stop.
So the leaders of the Sadducees arrested them and put them in jail until the next day.
But that did not have any effect, for nothing is impossible to God.
On that day alone, five thousand men came to believe in Jesus and became his disciples.
Then the Jewish leaders, the elders, and the teachers of the Law gathered in Jerusaiein.
They met with the High Priest Anna's and with Caiaphas, and the others who belonged to the High Priest's family.
Peter, full of the Holy Spirit; answered them.
Salvation is to be found through him alone; in all the world there is no one else whom God has given who can save us.
They all knew that Peter and John were ordinary men of no education.
But they were amazed to see how bold and courageous they were.
They realized then that they had been companions of Jesus.
But there was nothing that they could say, because they saw the man who had been healed standing there.
So they told them to leave the place, and then they started discussing among themselves.
They admitted that-the extraordinary miracle worked by them could not be dinied.
But Peter and John could accept what they said.
So they answered them, You yourselves judge which is right in God's sight-to obey you or to obey God.
For we cannot stop speaking of what we out-selves have seen and heard.
They saw that it was impossible to punish them, because the people were all praising God for what had happened.
So, out of fear of the people they set them free.
As soon as they were set free, they returned to the other disciples and told them what had happened.
When the believers heard it, they all joined together in prayer to God :
Lord God, take notice of the threats they have made, and allow us, your servants, to speak your message with all boldness.
Stretch out your hand to heal, and grant that wonders and miracles may be performed through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.
When they finished praying, the place where they were meeting was shaken.
They were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to proclaim God's message with boldness.
Many more people put their faith in Christ when they heard them preach.
Many who had been sick were cured.
They thought to themselves that if at least Peter's shadow falls on they would be healed.
So they carried the sick people out into the streets and placed them on beds and mats.
They came bringing those who were ill or who had evil spirits in theiY1; and they were all healed.
Peter the Apostle cured the man who had been lame from birth in the name of Jesus Christ.
Jesus had told them, Whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give it to you.
Peter and John were not afraid to give witness to Jesus.
They tried to explained to them that by doing so, they actually acted against God.
And they told them how they could receive forgiveness for their sins.
They said, Jesus Christ himself will save us from our sins and he will bless us.
Do we realize that the same sermon is preached to us.
Are we trying to be holy and keep our minds and hearts pure?
Each Christian is a disciple of Jesus Christ.
Like the Apostles, we too can preach the gospel of Christ through our words, actions and behaviour.
May be we cannot work any miracles, but we can comfort the sorrowful, take care of the sick and help the blind walk.
These are our moral obligations.
And remember, we have to be just in our dealings with everyone-, injustice brings down endless sorrow and suffering on us.
In the -world today there is so much injustice.
No one wants to oppose such injustices.
Life in the society has become unbearable on account of rampant injustice.
killing, oppression, addiction., etc.
It is the human, moral and social obligation of every citizen to free the nation from these evils.
You noticed that the Apostles were not afraid to speak up against the injustices done by the leaders of the society.
They called them to conversion of mind and heart and invited them to walk in the path of justice and truth.
We too have to walk in the way of justice and truth, and invite the sinners to come back to the right path.
There is no room for fear.
Do you think you can do it ?
We have to speak up boldly for the cause of justice and truth.
This is bearing witness to justice If someone makes a mistake, we should correct him.
In everything we must obey our conscience.
God always helps the one does good, and he lives in peace.
The Apostles received divine power when the Holy Spirit came down on them.
In the power of the Spirit they overcame all fear of death and began to preach the gospel of Christ with boldness.
There are always obstacles to doing good works.
But in order to attain success and to do something great, one has to face these problems and even risk one's life.
If we are afraid to get involved, then we can never achieve success.
Many a mountaineer had to fall and die in trying to reach the highest peak of the Himalayas.
Finally Hillary and Tenzing did what was considered impossible.
Later on others followed their path; they received inspiration from them.
In the same way, in the early days of the Church, the Apostles had to face great difficulties:
Many were persecuted by the Jews;
some even had to give their lives like Jesus.
Even then they did not stop preaching the gospel.
As a result now we can call ourselves Christian.
We have in front of us the supreme example of the life of Jesus and we have tasted nectar of his word.
One of the disciples had to give his life in trying to preach the word of Christ.
Now we will learn about the story of that most painful death.
Do you who that person was?
He was the first martyr, the great Saint Stephen, who was a preacher of Christianity.
Who is Stephen ?
As a result of the evangelization work by the Apostles, the number of Christians kept growing day by day.
Those who owned fields or houses would sell them, bring the money received from the sale, and hand it over to the apostles.
As the number of Christians grew, their property also increased.
The money was distributed to each one according to his need.
But when the number of Christians became large, everyone was not receiving enough food to eat.
As result there were complaints.
It is far more important to meet the spiritual needs and to preach the Word than catering to the physical needs.
So Peter advised that they should choose seven men from among themselves who were conscientious and full of wisdom.
They would be given charge of this matter and the apostles would give their full time -to prayer and the work of preaching.
Stephen was one of the seven who were chosen.
Stephen was a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit.
At first he was a member of the Jewish community to Antiochus.
And so the word of God continued to spread.
The number of disciples in Jerusalem grew larger and larger, and a great number of the Jewish priests accepted the faith in Christ.
The Arrest of Stephen Stephen used to preach the Word of Christ side by side with his other duties.
He performed many miracles by the power of God.
But he was opposed by some men who were members of the synagogue and they started arguing with him.
But the Spirit gave Stephen such wisdom that when he spoke, they could not refute him.
So they brought false accusations against him saying that they heard him speaking against Moses and against God.
In this way they stirred up the people, the elders and the teachers of the Law.
Finally they seized him and took him before the Council.
All those sitting in the Council fixed their eyes on Stephen and saw that his face looked like the face of an angel.
In order to verify what the people were saying, the High Priest said, Is it true?
Stephen began his famous speech by addressing them as brothers and fathers.
Gathering up courage he started from Abraham and Isaac.
God had appeared to Abraham and told him to leave his own country and go to live in another country.
His descendants would live-in a foreign country for four hundred years where they would be persecuted: God further said that he would judge them.
Later they would be brought out of that country.
Abraham's son was Isaac, and Isaac's son was Jacob, and Jacob had twelve sons, one of whom was Joseph.
Our of jealousy, Joseph's brothers had sold him for twenty silver pieces.
But God saved Joseph from all dangers.
Then there was a famine all over Egypt and Canaan, which caused much suffering.
When Joseph's brothers came to get corn, Joseph made himself known to them.
Then the whole family went to live in Egypt.
They are now known as the Israelites.
Their number kept growing large.
At last a king began to rule Egypt who was cruel.
He began to persecute the Jews.
He forced them to put their baby boys out of their homes, so that they would die.
Moses was born.
It was this Moses who finally delivered his people from the hands of Pharaoh.
According to God's plan, they, journeyed in the desert for forty years.
During these forty years God fed them with manna from heaven and provided then water to drink.
They were delivered from, the hands of Pharaoh and led to Canaan.
In this way Stephen narrated the history of Israel to the Council.
Finally he said to them, God has been so gracious to you; and yet your ancestors persecuted every prophet who came after Moses.
And finally you handed over Jesus Christ, the one sent by God, to the enemies and had him killed.
How stubborn you are!
You have killed God's messengers through whom you received God's law.
Everything that Stephen said was true, but the Jewish leaders and the priests could not bear it.
They because furious and ground their teeth at him in anger.
Stephen understood their feeling.
Full of the Holy Spirit, lie looked up to heaven and said, Look!
I see heaven opened and the son of Man standing at the right-hand side of God.
At this they started shouting.
Then they all rushed at him at once, threw him out of the city, and stoned him.
As they kept stoning him, he prayed saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!
He said this and died, and he was taken to eternal rest in the presence of God.
Stephen was so courageous!
We too have to face many hardships if we try to do something great.
But we should never fear and give tip.
God is always with us.
He always gives us the courage and the strength needed to do good works.
God has created us and he has given us many gifts.
We have to make use of these gifts.
For instance, lots of hard work and perseverance are necessary to carry on with studies.
Only then can one secure good results.
In our field of - work too, it is not always easy to maintain good relationship with our colleagues.
Everyone may not be equally honest and sincere.
It is our duty to correct someone who is doing wrong and bring him back to the right path.
Stephen had to lose his life in trying to bear witness to the truth.
To men his death may appear to be a defeat, but in the eyes of God it is a true victory.
He gave witness to Christ.
As a result of his martyrdom, the number of Christians grew more rapidly.
He is honoured as the first martyr.
Even today, those die for the faith, for the country, or for justice, are honoured as martyrs (shaheed) and heroes.
They are the glory of a nation or a country.
We show our respects to them.
In the history of the Christian Church, throughout the ages Stephen has been honoured as the first martyr.
In imitation of Jesus Christ, he too prayed to God for forgiveness just before his death, for those who killed him.
In this way he left us and example of giving witness to God, to justice and truth.
We have to make good use of the talents and qualities God has given us.
In out life there will be many problems, but we have to face them with wisdom, intelligence and prudence.
We have to stand for the truth and oppose injustice with courage.
We must respect all religions.
We must treat all people equally irrespective of their race, religion or caste.
We have to remember that all people-Hindus, Muslim, Buddhists, Christians- have been created by God.
We will deserve eternal punishment if we hate, envy, insult or kill someone because he professes a religion different from ours.
These are offences in the eyes of God.
These are mortal sins.
We must have courage to stand for truth and justice.
God always gives us strength and courage.
We should always shun the path of evil and follow the path of truth and justice.
